title: Delhi records over 1,000 new COVID cases, biggest spike since February 10; Maharashtra sees surge too
description: India COVID 19 Tally Not just the Delhi NCR Maharashtra also recorded a surge in its daily cases reporting 162 fresh infections on Wednesday
content: New Delhi | Jagran News Desk: Delhi on Wednesday reported a massive spike in its daily COVID-19 cases, recording 1,009 fresh infections in the past 24 hours - a 60 per cent increase from the previous day. The is the biggest spike in daily COVID-19 ca... [2747 chars]

title: Madhya Pradesh logs six COVID-19 cases; active tally at 45
description: Read more about Madhya Pradesh logs six COVID-19 cases; active tally at 45 on Devdiscourse
content: Madhya Pradesh has recorded six new cases of coronavirus in the last 24 hours that took the tally of infections to 10,41,266, an official from the state health department said on Wednesday. As many as 10 patients were discharged from hospitals during... [810 chars]

title: Maharashtra Records 162 New Covid-19 Infections, Zero Death; Active Case Tally at 690
description: The state's overall Covid-19 tally rose to 78,76,203, while the death toll remained unchanged at 1,47,830
content: Maharashtra on Wednesday recorded 162 fresh coronavirus cases, more than half of them in Mumbai alone, while no new death linked to the infection was registered in the state, the health department said. With this, the state's overall COVID-19 tally r... [1156 chars]

title: Delhi government mandates wearing of masks at public places amid spike in COVID cases
description: In view of the rising COVID-19 cases in the national capital over the past few days, the Delhi government on Wednesday made the wearing of masks mandatory at public places, said Lieutenant Governor Anil Baijal.
content: In view of the rising COVID-19 cases in the national capital over the past few days, the Delhi government on Wednesday made the wearing of masks mandatory at public places, said Lieutenant Governor Anil Baijal. Sources said that it also imposed Rs 50... [2071 chars]

title: COVID-19: Over 55 pc of beneficiaries in 15-18 age group fully vaccinated
description: Union Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya on Wednesday said that more than 55 per cent of youngsters between the 15-18 age group are now fully vaccinated against COVID-19.
content: Union Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya on Wednesday said that more than 55 per cent of youngsters between the 15-18 age group are now fully vaccinated against COVID-19. As many as 5,79,70,064 youngsters have been administered the first COVDI-19 dose... [1159 chars]

title: Massive spike: Delhi reports 1,009 new COVID-19 cases
description: Delhi on Wednesday reported 1,009 fresh covid19 cases, and 1 death in the last 24 hours, according to the health ministry. The positivity rate has reached 5.07%.

title: COVID-19 cases increasing in Delhi but hospitalisation low
description: Despite a spurt in Covid cases in Delhi, hospitalisation has so far been low accounting for less than three per cent of the total active cases, according to government data. On April 10, there were 608 active Covid-19 cases in Delhi which only 17 2.80 per cent required hospitalisation.Active cases doubled to 1,262 on April 16 but the number of patients in hospitals was just 29 2.3 per cent.

title: Cricket-After Marsh, Delhi team mate Seifert tests positive for COVID-19
description: Delhi had reported five positive cases on Tuesday and there was uncertainty around Wednesday's game against Punjab Kings, which eventually got off at Mumbai's Brabourne Stadium. "The decision on the change of venue was made as a precautionary measure after Delhi Capitals registered the sixth COVID case..." the IPL organisers said in a statement.
content: New Zealander Tim Seifert became Delhi Capitals' second overseas player to test positive for COVID-19 on Wednesday prompting the organisers of the Indian Premier League (IPL) to shift Friday's match from Pune to Mumbai. Delhi had reported five positi... [1327 chars]

title: Alleged Covid-19 Fraud Schemes Totaling $150 Million Draw Criminal Charges
description: Justice Department unveils charges that range from overcharging for medical services to selling fake vaccination cards
content: Federal prosecutors have charged about 20 people in the past two weeks with allegedly engaging in various fraud schemes related to the Covid-19 pandemic that amounted to about $150 million in improper government payments, officials said. The charges ... [500 chars]
